onset.Description: timepoint that stimulus appears on screen that matches scan timeseries

duration.Description: fixed period of time during which stimulus was on screen

coded_response.Description: response to survey question, reverse and forward coding taken into account
coded_response.Notes: Lower values generally indicate a more negative response, higher values generally indicate a more positive response.

item_coding.Description: whether the question was reverse coded or not

Levels.reverse: Question requires response to be reverse coded.
Levels.forward: Question requires response to be coded normally.

key_press.Notes: 66 was coded for thumb responses, 89 for index finger responses, 71 for middle finger responses, 82 for ring finger responses, and 77 for pinky finger responses.

possible_responses.Description: which keys were available to press as a response

Levels.66,89: two possible response options. Thumb = No, Index = Yes
Levels.66,89,71,82: four possible response options. Thumb = Disagree Strongly, Index = Disagree Some, Middle = Agree Some, Ring = Agree Strongly
Levels.66,89,71,82,77: five possible response options. Thumb = Not at all me / Not at all / Very Untrue, Pinky = Very much like me / Very much / Very True

possible_responses.Notes: Thumb, Index, Middle, Ring, Pinky fingers were used to press the keys.

survey.Description: which survey the specific question belongs to

Levels.impulsive_venture: subset of Impulsiveness-Venturesomeness (Eysenck, Pearson, Easting, & Allsopp, 1985)
Levels.upps: subset of UPPS+P impulsivity (Lynam, Smith, Whiteside, & Cyders, 2006)
